# kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Core Foundation ](/documentation/corefoundation)

- [ kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack ](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack)

-  kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack 

Global Variable# kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack

iOSiPadOSMac CatalystmacOStvOSvisionOSwatchOS

```
var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack: CFOptionFlags { get }
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack#Discussion)

When enabled using [`CFSocketSetSocketFlags(_:_:)`](/documentation/corefoundation/cfsocketsetsocketflags(_:_:)), the accept callback is called every time someone connects to your socket. When disabled, the accept callback is called only once the next time a new socket connection is accepted. The accept callback is automatically reenabled by default.

## [See Also](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack#see-also)

### [Constants](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack#Constants)

[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableReadCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenablereadcallback)[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenabledatacallback)[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableWriteCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenablewritecallback)[`var kCFSocketLeaveErrors: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketleaveerrors)[`var kCFSocketCloseOnInvalidate: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketcloseoninvalidate)When enabled using [`CFSocketSetSocketFlags(_:_:)`](/documentation/corefoundation/cfsocketsetsocketflags(_:_:)), the native socket associated with a CFSocket object is closed when the CFSocket object is invalidated. When disabled, the native socket remains open. This option is enabled by default.
